intro: Cenostigma angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cenostigma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a humid, temperate climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
